= asctime =
 function: string '''asctime'''(timestamp : integer);

The '''asctime''' function converts a Unix timestamp into a human-readable date and time string.

== Description ==
Converts a Unix timestamp (seconds since epoch) into a human-readable ASCII date and time string.

== Parameters ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Parameter !! Type !! Description
|-
| timestamp || integer || The Unix timestamp to convert, representing seconds since January 1, 1970 (epoch)
|}

== Return Value ==
Returns a string:
* '''string''' - A formatted date and time string in the format "Mon Nov 18 18:49:08 1996"
* '''fail''' - If timestamp parameter is invalid

== Examples ==
=== Current Time Display ===
 dilbegin show_time();
 var
    current_time : integer;
    time_string : string;
 code
 {
    current_time := realtime;
    time_string := asctime(current_time);
    send("Current time: " + time_string);
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Character Birth Information ===
 dilbegin birth_command();
 var
    pc : unitptr;
    birth_time : string;
 code
 {
    wait(SFB_CMD, command("birth") and (activator.type == UNIT_ST_PC));
    pc := activator;
    birth_time := asctime(pc.birth);
    send("Your character was created " + birth_time + ".");
    quit;
 } dilend

=== System Logging ===
 dilbegin system_check();
 var
    log_entry : string;
 code
 {
    log_entry := "System check at " + asctime(realtime);
    log(log_entry);
    send("System check logged.");
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Event Timestamping ===
 dilbegin event_log(event_name : string);
 var
    timestamp : integer;
    time_str : string;
 code
 {
    timestamp := realtime;
    time_str := asctime(timestamp);
    log("Event '" + event_name + "' occurred at " + time_str);
    send("Event logged with timestamp.");
    quit;
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The function uses the standard C library ctime() function internally
* The returned string format is always: "Day Month Date HH:MM:SS Year"
* Commonly used with realtime() to get current time
* Useful for logging, displaying creation times, or timestamping events
* The input parameter must be an integer representing Unix timestamp
* The format is consistent and predictable for all timestamps

== Error Handling ==
The function performs validation:
* '''Parameter validation'' - Ensures timestamp is a valid integer
* '''Range validation'' - Validates timestamp is within reasonable bounds
* '''Format validation'' - Ensures proper string format is returned
